comments:
Build 20031212

I got the following exception written to the log in my host while selfhosting
when my program under test (Eclipse) suspended at a breakpoint. The
configuration that I was using is named "Runtime-workbench". This may be related
to Bug 21710, because the exception occurred on the next launch after I
successfully reproduced Bug 21710, which fails while trying to launch with the
local Java application launch shortcut. Could be that the failed launch config
doesn't get cleaned up entirely?

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration New_configuration at
/home/jburns/target/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.debug.core/.launches/New_configuration.launch
does not exist.

Could not reproduce problem. However, removed uneccessary error logging from 
DefaulLabelProvider.
I don't understand. How is this logging unnecessary??

Generally, when rendering debug elements, many exceptions can occur, some of 
which are expected (for example, thread not suspended, invalid stack 
frame...). Polluting the log with these exceptions usually worries the user, 
when nothing is really wrong. In this case, a launch config associated with 
the launch, had been deleted (or no longer existed, due to some bug), but 
there is nothing the user can do (or should do), about it. It was likely a 
tranisent condition caused by other bugs. Over time, we have been removing 
such excessive exception logging.

I disagree. Errors are written to the log for developers (us), not users. The only logging we remove 
is logging from exceptions that we understand and expect. If we don't understand what caused this 
case, then we shouldn't remove the logging.
Replaced logging. However, can't reproduce error.

traces.message: Launch configuration New_configuration at /home/jburns/target/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.debug.core/.launches/New_configuration.launch does not exist.
